oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Reengineering a type II beta-turn as a potential helix nucleator-NMR characterization of Boc-Ala-Val-Pro-(D) Asp-Leu-Leu-NHMe
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: RAJU, EB
DHANASEKARAN, M
DURANI, S
SRIVASTAVA, S
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: proteins
peptide
conformation
spectra
design
model
water
type ii beta-turn
d-amino acid
peptide
nmr
helix
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A stereochemically constrained type II beta-turn is reengineered over two steps into a potential helix nucleator. NMR studies in DMSO establish that the hexapeptide Boc-Alal-Val2-Pro3-(D)Asp4-Leu5-Leu6-NHMe is a type II beta-turn at Pro3-(D)Asp4 with a conformation nucleating II-bond between Asp4 carboxylate and Leu6 NH, to which is attributable a type I/III beta-turn at Leu5-Leu6-NHMe potentially capable of serving as a helix template.
